modelIdentification.name: SISO-STD-001.1-2015 - Real-time Platform Reference Simulation Management FOM Module
modelIdentification.purpose: The RPR FOM supports interoperability for real-time, platform oriented defense simulation.

reference.identification: Real-time Platform Reference Base FOM Module
Standard for Guidance, Rationale, and Interoperability Modalities for the Real-time Platform Reference Federation Object Model (RPR FOM) SISO-STD-001-2015 10 August 2015
IEEE Standard for Distributed Interactive Simulation - Application Protocols IEEE Std 1278.1-1995 September 21, 1995
IEEE Standard for Distributed Interactive Simulation - Application Protocols IEEE Std 1278.1a-1998 19 March 1998

interactionClass.name: Acknowledge
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a SIMAN PDU from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the federate has implemented the request.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific StartResume, StopFreeze, CreateEntity or RemoveEntity interaction sent by the simulation manager.

parameter.name: AcknowledgeFlag
parameter.semantics: The type of interaction being acknowledged.

parameter.name: ResponseFlag
parameter.semantics: The type of response made to the interaction by the recipient.

interactionClass.name: AcknowledgeR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a SIMAN PDU, with a specified acknowledgement protocol, from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the federate has implemented the request.

interactionClass.name: ActionRequest
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction sent from a Simulation Manager federate to one or more federates to request that they perform a specified action.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: ActionRequestCode
parameter.semantics: The action that the recipient(s) are requested to perform.

parameter.name: FixedDatums
parameter.semantics: Optional additional data items (types and values)

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: Optional additional data items (types and values). These data items are not of fixed length.

interactionClass.name: ActionRequestR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction sent from a Simulation Manager federate to one or more federates to request that they perform a specified action. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: ActionResponse
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an ActionResponse interaction from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the federate has implemented the request.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific ActionRequest interaction sent by the simulation manager.

parameter.name: RequestStatus
parameter.semantics: The status of the request that the recipient has been asked to perform.

parameter.name: FixedDatums
parameter.semantics: Additional, fixed length data items (types and values).

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: Additional, non fixed length, data items (types and values).

interactionClass.name: ActionResponseR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an ActionResponseR interaction from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the federate has implemented the request.

interactionClass.name: Comment
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction used to insert messages and information into a log stream and closely matches the structures used by the Data interaction class. This information is usually unsolicited in nature. The information contained within the Interaction should be used for commenting purposes only.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: The set of data items (types and values) associated with the interaction.

interactionClass.name: CreateEntity
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that an application creates an entity. See DIS 4.5.5.4.1 and DIS 5.3.6 for details.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The FederateIdentifier field identifies the federate that is responsible for creating the entity (if possible). The complete parameter defines the entity ID of the new entity (see also note [18]).

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

interactionClass.name: CreateEntityR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that an application creates an entity, using a specified acknowledgement service. See DIS 4.5.11.3.1 and DIS 5.3.12.1 for details.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: Data
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge either a) a DataQuery interaction (in which case the Data interaction contains the results of the query) or b) a SetData interaction (in which case the Data interaction contains the data that the federate was able to set).

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific SetData or DataQuery interaction sent by the simulation manager.

parameter.name: FixedDatums
parameter.semantics: The set of data items (types and values), of fixed length, that the recipient can return for this interaction.

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: The set of data items (types and values), of variable length, that the recipient can return for this interaction.

interactionClass.name: DataR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge either a) a DataQueryR interaction (in which case the DataR interaction contains the results of the query) or b) a SetDataR interaction (in which case the DataR interaction contains the data that the federate was able to set).

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: DataQuery
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that a federate supply the current values of specified data.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: TimeInterval
parameter.semantics: The interval between regular updates of the requested data. If this field is zero then the recipient should only issue a single Data interaction in response to this interaction.

parameter.name: FixedDatumIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: The set of fixed length data items (types) that the recipient is requested to supply data for.

parameter.name: VariableDatumIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: The set of variable length data items (types) that the recipient is requested to supply data for.

interactionClass.name: DataQueryR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that a federate supply the current values of specified data. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: EventReport
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to allow a federate to alert a Simulation Manager federate that a particular event has occurred.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: EventType
parameter.semantics: The type of event being reported.

parameter.name: FixedDatums
parameter.semantics: The set of fixed size data items (types and values) associated with this event.

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: The set of variable size data items (types and values) associated with this event.

interactionClass.name: RemoveEntity
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that a specified entity be removed from the simulation.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

interactionClass.name: RemoveEntityR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that a specified entity be removed from the simulation.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: SetData
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that a federate sets the values of specified data to specified values.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: FixedDatums
parameter.semantics: The set of fixed length data items (types and values) that the recipient is requested to set.

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: The set of variables length data items (types and values) that the recipient is requested to set.

interactionClass.name: SetDataR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that a federate sets the values of specified data to specified values. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: StartResume
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to either a) start simulating one or more entities or b) resume simulation of one or more entities after a pause.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RealWorldTime
parameter.semantics: The real world time (GMT) that the entity or entities should start/resume at.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: SimulationTime
parameter.semantics: The simulation time that the entity or entities should use when they start/resume.

interactionClass.name: StartResumeR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to either a) start simulating one or more entities or b) resume simulation of one or more entities after a pause. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: StopFreeze
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that one or more entities either a) freeze (pause) their simulation or b) stop their simulation.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: RealWorldTime
parameter.semantics: The real world time (GMT) that the entity or entities should stop/freeze at.

parameter.name: Reason
parameter.semantics: The reason for the stop or freeze.

parameter.name: ReflectValues
parameter.semantics: Whether the entity or entities being stopped/frozen should continue to reflect values when stopped/frozen.

parameter.name: RunInternalSimulationClock
parameter.semantics: Whether the entity or entities being stopped/frozen should continue to run their internal simulation clock when stopped/frozen.

parameter.name: UpdateAttributes
parameter.semantics: Whether the entity or entities being stopped/frozen should continue to update attributes when stopped/frozen.

interactionClass.name: StopFreezeR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that one or more entities either a) pause their simulation or b) stop their simulation. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: RecordR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a RecordQueryR or SetRecordR interaction from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the federate has implemented the request.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific RecordQueryR or SetRecordR interaction sent by the simulation manager.

parameter.name: EventType
parameter.semantics: The type of event that caused the RecordR interaction to be issued.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for the transaction

parameter.name: ResponseSerialNumber
parameter.semantics: Used to identify the serial number of the RecordR interaction when more than one interaction is used to report record values.

parameter.name: RecordSetData
parameter.semantics: The set of records containing the information requested

interactionClass.name: RecordQueryR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to allow a Simulation Manager federate to request data, in record format, from another federate.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: TimeInterval
parameter.semantics: The interval between regular updates of the requested data. If this field is zero then the recipient should only issue a single RecordR interaction in response to this interaction.

parameter.name: EventType
parameter.semantics: Specifies the type of event that the receiving entity or application should use to trigger the issue of a RecordR interaction in response to this query. If this is zero, then reporting shall be periodic based upon the value of the TimeInterval parameter.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for the transaction

parameter.name: RecordIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: Identifies the records for which information is requested

interactionClass.name: SetRecordR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that a federate sets the values of specified data to specified values (provided in record format).

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

parameter.name: RecordSetData
parameter.semantics: Specifies the information, in record format, to be set by the receiving entity.

interactionClass.name: TransferControl
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent to initiate the transfer of control of an entity.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: TransferType
parameter.semantics: The type of transfer to be performed.

parameter.name: TransferEntity
parameter.semantics: The ID of the object to be transferred.

parameter.name: RecordSetData
parameter.semantics: Specifies the information, in record format, to be set by the receiving entity.

interactionClass.name: AttributeChangeRequest
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to ask that a specified attribute be set to a specified value.

parameter.name: ObjectIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: The list of objects that are the intended recipients of this interaction.

parameter.name: AttributeValueSet
parameter.semantics: The set of attributes and their values, that the recipients are asked to update.

interactionClass.name: AttributeChangeRequestR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to ask that a specified attribute be set to a specified value. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: AttributeChangeResult
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an AttributeChangeRequest interaction from a Simulation Manager federate, and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the attribute was set to the specified value or not.

parameter.name: ObjectIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The ID of the object replying to the AttributeChangeRequest interaction.

parameter.name: AttributeChangeResult
parameter.semantics: Indicates ability to comply.

parameter.name: AttributeValueSet
parameter.semantics: The set of attributes and their values that the recipient has been able to update.

interactionClass.name: AttributeChangeResultR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an AttributeChangeRequest interaction from a Simulation Manager federate, and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the attribute was set to the specified value or not. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for this transaction

interactionClass.name: CreateObjectRequest
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to another federate requesting that it create an object instance of a particular type.

parameter.name: ObjectClass
parameter.semantics: The class of object to be created.

parameter.name: AttributeValueSet
parameter.semantics: The set of attributes, and associated values, to be used to initialize the object.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

interactionClass.name: CreateObjectRequestR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to another federate requesting that it create an object instance of a particular type. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: CreateObjectResult
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a CreateObjectRequest from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the object creation was successful or not.

parameter.name: CreateObjectResult
parameter.semantics: Indicates ability to comply.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific CreateObject interaction sent by the simulation manager.

interactionClass.name: CreateObjectResultR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a CreateObjectRequest from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the object creation was successful or not. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

interactionClass.name: RemoveObjectRequest
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that one or more specified objects be removed from the simulation.

parameter.name: ObjectIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: The IDs of the objects to be removed.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

interactionClass.name: RemoveObjectRequestR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that one or more specified objects be removed from the simulation.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: RemoveObjectResult
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a RemoveObjectRequest interaction, and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the removal was successful or not.

parameter.name: RemoveObjectResult
parameter.semantics: Indicates ability to comply.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific RemoveObject interaction sent by the simulation manager.

interactionClass.name: RemoveObjectResultR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a RemoveObjectRequestR interaction, and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the removal was successful or not.

interactionClass.name: ActionRequestToObject
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction sent from a Simulation Manager federate to one or more specific object instances to request that they perform a specified action.

parameter.name: ObjectIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: The list of objects that are the intended recipients of this interaction.

parameter.name: ActionRequestCode
parameter.semantics: The action that the recipient(s) are intended to perform.

interactionClass.name: ActionRequestToObjectR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction sent from a Simulation Manager federate to one or more specific object instances to request that they perform a specified action. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for this transaction

interactionClass.name: ActionResponseFromObject
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an ActionResponseToObject interaction from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the object has implemented the request.

parameter.name: ActionResult
parameter.semantics: The status of the request that the recipient has been asked to perform.

interactionClass.name: ActionResponseFromObjectR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an ActionResponseToObjectR interaction from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the object has implemented the request.

fixedRecordData.name: AttributeValuePairStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Pair of an AttributeHandle identifying an attribute and data for that attribute.

field.name: PaddingTo32
field.semantics: Brings the record length to a 32-bit boundary

fixedRecordData.name: FixedDatumStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Identifier and value for a fixed datum.

field.name: FixedDatumIdentifier
field.semantics: The identifier for this fixed datum.

field.name: FixedDatumValue
field.semantics: The value for this fixed datum.

fixedRecordData.name: RecordSetStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: A set of records and record details.

field.name: RecordSetIdentifier
field.semantics: This field shall specify the data structure used to convey the parameter values of the record for each record.

field.name: RecordSetSerialNumber
field.semantics: This field shall specify the serial number of the first record in the array.

field.name: NumberOfRecords-A-RecordValues
field.semantics: This field contains the records of the format specified by the Record ID field.

field.name: PaddingTo32
field.semantics: Brings the record length to a 32-bit boundary

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN1
note.semantics: See DIS 4.5.11 for a description of the acknowledgement protocols (called reliability services in that document).

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN2
note.semantics: The ActionResponseR interaction should be sent in response to an ActionRequestR interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN3
note.semantics: The ActionResponseFromObjectR interaction should be sent in response to an ActionRequestToObjectR interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN4
note.semantics:
The AttributeChangeResultR interaction should be sent in response to an AttributeChangeRequestR interaction by any object that is mentioned in the associated object list. The AttributeChangeResult parameter should indicate the success or failure of the object to implement the requested changes. If the object can implement the changes then the AttributeChangeResult parameter should be set to successful and the AttributeValueSet shall be empty.
If the object cannot immediately comply with the request, but is likely to be able to comply in the future then the AttributeChangeRequest parameter shall be set to pending and the AttributeValueSet shall be empty. When the object complies with the request (or fails to implement the request) then another AttributeChangeResultR interaction shall be sent informing the initiating federate of the result of the request.
If the object cannot comply with the request then the AttributeChangeResult parameter shall indicate the reason why the object cannot comply with the request, The AttributeValueSet shall contain the attributes which have been not been set and the current values of those attributes.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN5
note.semantics: The AcknowledgeR interaction is issued in response to the CreateEntityR, RemoveEntityR, StartResumeR, and StopFreezeR interactions. See (DIS 4.4.11.3.5 Acknowledge-R PDU) and (DIS 5.3.12.5 Acknowledge-R PDU).

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN6
note.semantics: The DataR interaction should be sent in response to a DataQueryR interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN7
note.semantics: The standard acknowledgement protocol is identical to the requirements of SIMAN in DIS 1278.1-1995 (i.e. it acts identically to the parent interaction) - see DIS 4.5.5. The other acknowledgement protocols are described in DIS 4.5.11 (they are called reliability services in that document).

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN8
note.semantics: The DataR interaction should be sent in response to a SetDataR interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN9
note.semantics: The RecordR interaction should be sent in response to a SetRecordR interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN10
note.semantics: The CreateObjectResultR interaction should be sent in response to an CreateObjectRequestR interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN11
note.semantics:
The AttributeChangeResult interaction should be sent in response to an AttributeChangeRequest interaction by any object that is mentioned in the associated object list. The AttributeChangeResult parameter should indicate the success or failure of the object to implement the requested changes. If the object can implement the changes then the AttributeChangeResult parameter should be set to successful and the AttributeValueSet shall be empty.
If the object cannot immediately comply with the request, but is likely to be able to comply in the future then the AttributeChangeRequest parameter shall be set to pending and the AttributeValueSet shall be empty. When the object complies with the request (or fails to implement the request) then another AttributeChangeResult interaction shall be sent informing the initiating federate of the result of the request.
If the object cannot comply with the request then the AttributeChangeResult parameter shall indicate the reason why the object cannot comply with the request, The AttributeValueSet shall contain the attributes which have been not been set and the current values of those attributes.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN12
note.semantics: The Acknowledge interaction is issued in response to the CreateEntity, RemoveEntity, StartResume, and StopFreeze interactions. See (DIS 4.4.5.4.5 Acknowledge PDU) and (DIS 5.4.6.5 Acknowledge PDU)."

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN13
note.semantics: If the EntityNumber field is set to RQST_ASSIGN_ID (hex FFFE) then the receiving application should assign the entity number. Entity identifications shall be in accordance with DIS 5.2.14.2.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN14
note.semantics: The units of the FixedDatumValue field is determined by the value of the FixedDatumIdentifier field. The units, etc., for each of the FixedDatumIdentifier enumeration values are to be derived from the federation agreements, which could refer to SISO-REF-010.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN15
note.semantics: The CreateObjectResult interaction should be sent in response to an CreateObjectRequest interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN16
note.semantics: The ActionResponse interaction should be sent in response to an ActionRequest interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN17
note.semantics: The ActionResponseFromObject interaction should be sent in response to an ActionRequestToObject interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN18
note.semantics: The Data interaction should be sent in response to a DataQuery interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN19
note.semantics: The Data interaction should be sent in response to a SetData interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN20
note.semantics: The RemoveObjectResult interaction should be sent in response to an RemoveObjectRequest interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN21
note.semantics: The RecordR interaction should be sent in response to a RecordQueryR interaction by the receiving federate.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN22
note.semantics: The type of the RecordStruct is determined by the value of the RecordSetIdentifier field. The types and associated units, etc., for each of the RecordSetIdentifier enumeration values The values for the individual fields are to be derived from the federation agreements, which could refer to SISO-REF-010.

note.label: RPRnoteSIMAN23
note.semantics: All padding fields shall be set to the value 0
